intro: Melothria antunesii, commonly known as the Antunes' little cucumber, is a species of flowering plant in the Cucurbitaceae family. It is a small, trailing vine native to Madagascar, characterized by its slender stems and small, hairy leaves. The plant produces tiny, yellowish-green fruits that are typically less than 1 cm in diameter. It is adapted to grow in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in humid, tropical climates. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its ecosystem.
